docs.title: Class: Yield
docs.text:
A dimensionless physical quantity describing the fraction of a product B that is formed from a reactant A taking into account the stoichiometry. If A fully reacts to B without side-reactions, the yield of product B is 1 (or 100 %).

URI: qudt:Quantity

docs.title: Enum: PhysicalStateEnum
docs.text: URI: chemdcatap:enum/PhysicalStateEnum

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description SOLID PATO:0001736 A state of matter in which molecules are closely packed and cannot move past each other. CRYSTAL PATO:0002066 A solid state of matter whose constituents (such as atoms, molecules, or ions) are arranged in a highly ordered microscopic structure, forming a crystal lattice that extends in all directions. LIQUID PATO:0001735 A state of matter with a definite volume but no fixed shape. Liquids adapt to the shape of their container and are nearly incompressible, maintaining their volume even under pressure. GASEOUS PATO:0001737 A state of matter with neither fixed volume nor fixed shape.

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description has_physical_state The slot to specify the physical state of a MaterialEntity.

permissible_values:
  SOLID:
    text: SOLID
    description: A state of matter in which molecules are closely packed and cannot
      move past each other.
    meaning: PATO:0001736
  CRYSTAL:
    text: CRYSTAL
    description: A solid state of matter whose constituents (such as atoms, molecules,
      or ions) are arranged in a highly ordered microscopic structure, forming a crystal
      lattice that extends in all directions.
    meaning: PATO:0002066
  LIQUID:
    text: LIQUID
    description: A state of matter with a definite volume but no fixed shape. Liquids
      adapt to the shape of their container and are nearly incompressible, maintaining
      their volume even under pressure.
    meaning: PATO:0001735
  GASEOUS:
    text: GASEOUS
    description: A state of matter with neither fixed volume nor fixed shape.
    meaning: PATO:0001737

docs.title: Slot: alternative_label
docs.text:
The slot to specify an alternative label, name or title for a MaterialEntity.

URI: skos:altLabel Alias: alternative_label

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot ChemicalEntity Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity. no ChemicalProduct A chemical substance that is produced by a ChemicalReaction. no SubstanceSample A MaterialSample derived from a chemical substance that is of interest in an analytical procedure. no Atom A MaterialEntity constituting the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element. no PolymerMixin A LinkML mixin used to pass down properties common to all chemical substances that are composed of macromolecules of different kinds and which may be differentiated by composition, length, degree of branching etc.. no ChemicalSubstanceMixin A LinkML mixin used to pass down properties common to all material entities that are described in a chemical context via being composed of chemical entities (e.g. atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, complex, conformer etc., ) of the same type or of different types. no Reagent A ChemicalSubstance that is consumed or transformed in a ChemicalReaction. no Reactor A reactor is a container for controlling a biological or chemical reaction or process. no MaterialEntity A material is an Entity that has some portion of matter as proper part. no MaterialSample A Sample that was derived from a previous MaterialSample or some other kind of MaterialEntity. no MaterialisticMixin A LinkML mixin used to pass down properties common to all material entities. It is needed for example to have MaterialSample have the same properties as MaterialEntity, although it is defined as a subclass of EvaluatedEntity. no DissolvingSubstance A liquid ChemicalSubstance that dissolves or that is capable of dissolving a ChemicalSubstance. no PolymerSample A SubstanceSample derived from a Polymer. no Catalyst A ChemicalSubstance or MaterialEntity that initiates or accelerates a ChemicalReaction without itself being affected. no StartingMaterial A ChemicalSubstance with that has a starting material role in a synthesis. no

docs.title: Slot: description
docs.text:
This slot is described in more detail within the class in which it is used.

URI: dcterms:description Alias: description

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot SubstanceSample A MaterialSample derived from a chemical substance that is of interest in an analytical procedure. no Atom A MaterialEntity constituting the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element. no StartingMaterial A ChemicalSubstance with that has a starting material role in a synthesis. no Plan A piece of information that specifies how an activity has to be carried out by its agents including what kind of steps have to be taken and what kind of parameters have to be met/set. no Surrounding The surrounding in which the dataset creating activity took place (e.g. a lab). no AgenticEntity An entity that is somehow responsible for an Activity to take place. no Attribution See DCAT-AP specs:Attribution no ConceptScheme See DCAT-AP specs:ConceptScheme no MaterialSample A Sample that was derived from a previous MaterialSample or some other kind of MaterialEntity. no MolarEquivalent A dimensionless ratio that quantifies the stoichiometric proportion of a chemical substance relative to a reference substance in a chemical reaction. no Frequency See DCAT-AP specs:Frequency no Dataset A collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more representations. yes Density A measure of the mass per unit volume of a substance. no PolymerSample A SubstanceSample derived from a Polymer. no Document See DCAT-AP specs:Document no Mass The strength of a body's gravitational attraction to other bodies. no LegalResource See DCAT-AP specs:LegalResource no Catalyst A ChemicalSubstance or MaterialEntity that initiates or accelerates a ChemicalReaction without itself being affected. no ChemicalEntity Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity. no Distribution See DCAT-AP specs:Distribution yes ChemicalProduct A chemical substance that is produced by a ChemicalReaction. no ProvenanceStatement See DCAT-AP specs:ProvenanceStatement no Concept See DCAT-AP specs:Concept no LicenseDocument See DCAT-AP specs:LicenseDocument no Pressure no DatasetSeries See DCAT-AP specs:DatasetSeries yes Reagent A ChemicalSubstance that is consumed or transformed in a ChemicalReaction. no LinguisticSystem See DCAT-AP specs:LinguisticSystem no Geometry See DCAT-AP specs:Geometry no MediaType See DCAT-AP specs:MediaType no Activity See DCAT-AP specs:Activity yes EvaluatedEntity An Entity that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. yes AmountOfSubstance The total amount of substance used in a ChemicalReaction. no Volume A measure of regions in three-dimensional space. no Entity A physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary. yes DataAnalysis An Activity that evaluates the data produced by another Activity. no PHValue no CatalogueRecord See DCAT-AP specs:CatalogueRecord yes PeriodOfTime See DCAT-AP specs:PeriodOfTime no MediaTypeOrExtent See DCAT-AP specs:MediaTypeOrExtent no Software An instrument composed of a series of instructions that can be interpreted by or directly executed by a computer. no Device A material instrument that is designed to perform a function primarily by means of its mechanical or electrical nature. no AnalysisSourceData Information that was evaluated within a DataAnalysis. no IUPACName A systematic name which is formulated according to the rules and recommendations for chemical nomenclature set out by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC). no MaterialEntity A material is an Entity that has some portion of matter as proper part. no ChemicalReaction A process that leads to the transformation of one set of chemical substances to another and that is the subject matter of a DataGeneratingActivity. no ChecksumAlgorithm See DCAT-AP specs:ChecksumAlgorithm no InChi A structure descriptor which conforms to the InChI format specification. no Policy See DCAT-AP specs:Policy no DissolvingSubstance A liquid ChemicalSubstance that dissolves or that is capable of dissolving a ChemicalSubstance. no EvaluatedActivity An activity or process that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. no Identifier See DCAT-AP specs:Identifier no SupportiveEntity The supportive entities are supporting the main entities in the Application Profile. They are included in the Application Profile because they form the range of properties. no Any This abstract class is needed to create the union of Dataset, DatasetSeries, Catalogue and DataService for the range of the slot primary_topic. no DataService See DCAT-AP specs:DataService yes QuantitativeAttribute A quantifiable piece of information that is attributed to an Entity, Activity or AgenticEntity. no Resource See DCAT-AP specs:Resource no Standard See DCAT-AP specs:Standard no InChIKey no Concentration A QuantitativeAttribute of a ChemicalSubstance that represents the amount of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture. no Reactor A reactor is a container for controlling a biological or chemical reaction or process. no SMILES A structure descriptor that denotes a molecular structure as a graph and conforms to the SMILES format specification. no QualitativeAttribute A piece of information that is attributed to an Entity, Activity or AgenticEntity. no RightsStatement See DCAT-AP specs:RightsStatement no TimeInstant See DCAT-AP specs:TimeInstant no Catalogue See DCAT-AP specs:Catalogue yes MolecularFormula A structure descriptor which identifies each constituent element by its chemical symbol and indicates the number of atoms of each element found in each discrete molecule of that compound. no AnalysisDataset A Dataset that was generated by an analysis of some previously generated data. For example, a dataset that contains the data of an assignment of a chemical structure to a sample based on the spectral data obtained from the sample is an AnalyticalDataset. no Laboratory A facility that provides controlled conditions in which scientific or technological research, experiments, and measurement may be performed. no Temperature A physical quantity that quantitatively expresses the attribute of hotness or coldness. no Yield A dimensionless physical quantity describing the fraction of a product B that is formed from a reactant A taking into account the stoichiometry. If A fully reacts to B without side-reactions, the yield of product B is 1 (or 100 %). no PercentageOfTotal A dimensionless ratio that quantifies the stoichiometric proportion of a chemical substance relative to a reference substance in a chemical reaction. no Role See DCAT-AP specs:Role no MolarMass A Mass (physical quality) that quantifies the mass of a homogeneous ChemicalSubstance containing 6.02 x 10^23 atoms or molecules. no DataGeneratingActivity An Activity (process) that has the objective to produce information (in form of a dataset) about another Activity or Entity. no

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot PHValue no QuantitativeAttribute A quantifiable piece of information that is attributed to an Entity, Activity or AgenticEntity. no Concentration A QuantitativeAttribute of a ChemicalSubstance that represents the amount of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture. no Pressure no MolarEquivalent A dimensionless ratio that quantifies the stoichiometric proportion of a chemical substance relative to a reference substance in a chemical reaction. no Density A measure of the mass per unit volume of a substance. no Temperature A physical quantity that quantitatively expresses the attribute of hotness or coldness. no Yield A dimensionless physical quantity describing the fraction of a product B that is formed from a reactant A taking into account the stoichiometry. If A fully reacts to B without side-reactions, the yield of product B is 1 (or 100 %). no PercentageOfTotal A dimensionless ratio that quantifies the stoichiometric proportion of a chemical substance relative to a reference substance in a chemical reaction. no AmountOfSubstance The total amount of substance used in a ChemicalReaction. no Mass The strength of a body's gravitational attraction to other bodies. no Volume A measure of regions in three-dimensional space. no MolarMass A Mass (physical quality) that quantifies the mass of a homogeneous ChemicalSubstance containing 6.02 x 10^23 atoms or molecules. no

docs.text:

URI: adms:identifier Alias: other_identifier

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot SubstanceSample A MaterialSample derived from a chemical substance that is of interest in an analytical procedure. no Atom A MaterialEntity constituting the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element. no AgenticEntity An entity that is somehow responsible for an Activity to take place. yes MaterialSample A Sample that was derived from a previous MaterialSample or some other kind of MaterialEntity. no Dataset A collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more representations. yes PolymerSample A SubstanceSample derived from a Polymer. no Catalyst A ChemicalSubstance or MaterialEntity that initiates or accelerates a ChemicalReaction without itself being affected. no ChemicalEntity Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity. no ChemicalProduct A chemical substance that is produced by a ChemicalReaction. no Reagent A ChemicalSubstance that is consumed or transformed in a ChemicalReaction. no Activity See DCAT-AP specs:Activity yes EvaluatedEntity An Entity that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. yes Entity A physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary. yes DataAnalysis An Activity that evaluates the data produced by another Activity. no ChemicalReaction A process that leads to the transformation of one set of chemical substances to another and that is the subject matter of a DataGeneratingActivity. no Software An instrument composed of a series of instructions that can be interpreted by or directly executed by a computer. yes Device A material instrument that is designed to perform a function primarily by means of its mechanical or electrical nature. yes AnalysisSourceData Information that was evaluated within a DataAnalysis. no MaterialEntity A material is an Entity that has some portion of matter as proper part. no DissolvingSubstance A liquid ChemicalSubstance that dissolves or that is capable of dissolving a ChemicalSubstance. no EvaluatedActivity An activity or process that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. yes Reactor A reactor is a container for controlling a biological or chemical reaction or process. no AnalysisDataset A Dataset that was generated by an analysis of some previously generated data. For example, a dataset that contains the data of an assignment of a chemical structure to a sample based on the spectral data obtained from the sample is an AnalyticalDataset. no StartingMaterial A ChemicalSubstance with that has a starting material role in a synthesis. no DataGeneratingActivity An Activity (process) that has the objective to produce information (in form of a dataset) about another Activity or Entity. no

This slot is described in more detail within the class in which it is used.

URI: dcterms:provenance Alias: provenance

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot Dataset A collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more representations. yes AnalysisDataset A Dataset that was generated by an analysis of some previously generated data. For example, a dataset that contains the data of an assignment of a chemical structure to a sample based on the spectral data obtained from the sample is an AnalyticalDataset. no

docs.title: Slot: rdf_type
docs.text:
The slot to specify the ontology class that is instantiated by an entity.

URI: rdf:type Alias: rdf_type

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot SubstanceSample A MaterialSample derived from a chemical substance that is of interest in an analytical procedure. no Atom A MaterialEntity constituting the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element. yes StartingMaterial A ChemicalSubstance with that has a starting material role in a synthesis. no Plan A piece of information that specifies how an activity has to be carried out by its agents including what kind of steps have to be taken and what kind of parameters have to be met/set. no Surrounding The surrounding in which the dataset creating activity took place (e.g. a lab). no AgenticEntity An entity that is somehow responsible for an Activity to take place. no MaterialSample A Sample that was derived from a previous MaterialSample or some other kind of MaterialEntity. no MolarEquivalent A dimensionless ratio that quantifies the stoichiometric proportion of a chemical substance relative to a reference substance in a chemical reaction. no Density A measure of the mass per unit volume of a substance. no PolymerSample A SubstanceSample derived from a Polymer. no Mass The strength of a body's gravitational attraction to other bodies. no Catalyst A ChemicalSubstance or MaterialEntity that initiates or accelerates a ChemicalReaction without itself being affected. no ChemicalEntity Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity. no ChemicalProduct A chemical substance that is produced by a ChemicalReaction. no Pressure no Reagent A ChemicalSubstance that is consumed or transformed in a ChemicalReaction. no Activity See DCAT-AP specs:Activity no EvaluatedEntity An Entity that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. no AmountOfSubstance The total amount of substance used in a ChemicalReaction. no Volume A measure of regions in three-dimensional space. no Entity A physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary. no DataAnalysis An Activity that evaluates the data produced by another Activity. no ClassifierMixin A mixin with which an entity of this schema can be classified via an additional rdf:type or dcterms:type assertion. no PHValue no ChemicalReaction A process that leads to the transformation of one set of chemical substances to another and that is the subject matter of a DataGeneratingActivity. no Software An instrument composed of a series of instructions that can be interpreted by or directly executed by a computer. no Device A material instrument that is designed to perform a function primarily by means of its mechanical or electrical nature. no AnalysisSourceData Information that was evaluated within a DataAnalysis. no IUPACName A systematic name which is formulated according to the rules and recommendations for chemical nomenclature set out by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC). no MaterialEntity A material is an Entity that has some portion of matter as proper part. no InChi A structure descriptor which conforms to the InChI format specification. no DissolvingSubstance A liquid ChemicalSubstance that dissolves or that is capable of dissolving a ChemicalSubstance. no EvaluatedActivity An activity or process that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. no QuantitativeAttribute A quantifiable piece of information that is attributed to an Entity, Activity or AgenticEntity. no InChIKey no Concentration A QuantitativeAttribute of a ChemicalSubstance that represents the amount of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture. no Reactor A reactor is a container for controlling a biological or chemical reaction or process. no SMILES A structure descriptor that denotes a molecular structure as a graph and conforms to the SMILES format specification. no QualitativeAttribute A piece of information that is attributed to an Entity, Activity or AgenticEntity. no MolecularFormula A structure descriptor which identifies each constituent element by its chemical symbol and indicates the number of atoms of each element found in each discrete molecule of that compound. no Laboratory A facility that provides controlled conditions in which scientific or technological research, experiments, and measurement may be performed. no Temperature A physical quantity that quantitatively expresses the attribute of hotness or coldness. no Yield A dimensionless physical quantity describing the fraction of a product B that is formed from a reactant A taking into account the stoichiometry. If A fully reacts to B without side-reactions, the yield of product B is 1 (or 100 %). no PercentageOfTotal A dimensionless ratio that quantifies the stoichiometric proportion of a chemical substance relative to a reference substance in a chemical reaction. no MolarMass A Mass (physical quality) that quantifies the mass of a homogeneous ChemicalSubstance containing 6.02 x 10^23 atoms or molecules. no DataGeneratingActivity An Activity (process) that has the objective to produce information (in form of a dataset) about another Activity or Entity. no

docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot DefinedTerm A word, name, acronym or phrase that is defined in a controlled vocabulary (CV) and that is used to provide an additional rdf:type or dcterms:type of a class within this schema. yes SubstanceSample A MaterialSample derived from a chemical substance that is of interest in an analytical procedure. no Atom A MaterialEntity constituting the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element. no Plan A piece of information that specifies how an activity has to be carried out by its agents including what kind of steps have to be taken and what kind of parameters have to be met/set. no StartingMaterial A ChemicalSubstance with that has a starting material role in a synthesis. no Surrounding The surrounding in which the dataset creating activity took place (e.g. a lab). no AgenticEntity An entity that is somehow responsible for an Activity to take place. no Attribution See DCAT-AP specs:Attribution no ConceptScheme See DCAT-AP specs:ConceptScheme yes MaterialSample A Sample that was derived from a previous MaterialSample or some other kind of MaterialEntity. no MolarEquivalent A dimensionless ratio that quantifies the stoichiometric proportion of a chemical substance relative to a reference substance in a chemical reaction. no Frequency See DCAT-AP specs:Frequency no Dataset A collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more representations. yes Density A measure of the mass per unit volume of a substance. no PolymerSample A SubstanceSample derived from a Polymer. no Document See DCAT-AP specs:Document no Mass The strength of a body's gravitational attraction to other bodies. no LegalResource See DCAT-AP specs:LegalResource no Catalyst A ChemicalSubstance or MaterialEntity that initiates or accelerates a ChemicalReaction without itself being affected. no ChemicalEntity Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity. no Distribution See DCAT-AP specs:Distribution yes ChemicalProduct A chemical substance that is produced by a ChemicalReaction. no ProvenanceStatement See DCAT-AP specs:ProvenanceStatement no Concept See DCAT-AP specs:Concept no LicenseDocument See DCAT-AP specs:LicenseDocument no Pressure no DatasetSeries See DCAT-AP specs:DatasetSeries yes Reagent A ChemicalSubstance that is consumed or transformed in a ChemicalReaction. no LinguisticSystem See DCAT-AP specs:LinguisticSystem no Geometry See DCAT-AP specs:Geometry no MediaType See DCAT-AP specs:MediaType no Activity See DCAT-AP specs:Activity yes EvaluatedEntity An Entity that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. yes AmountOfSubstance The total amount of substance used in a ChemicalReaction. no Volume A measure of regions in three-dimensional space. no Entity A physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary. yes DataAnalysis An Activity that evaluates the data produced by another Activity. no PHValue no CatalogueRecord See DCAT-AP specs:CatalogueRecord yes PeriodOfTime See DCAT-AP specs:PeriodOfTime no MediaTypeOrExtent See DCAT-AP specs:MediaTypeOrExtent no Software An instrument composed of a series of instructions that can be interpreted by or directly executed by a computer. no Device A material instrument that is designed to perform a function primarily by means of its mechanical or electrical nature. no AnalysisSourceData Information that was evaluated within a DataAnalysis. no IUPACName A systematic name which is formulated according to the rules and recommendations for chemical nomenclature set out by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC). no MaterialEntity A material is an Entity that has some portion of matter as proper part. no ChemicalReaction A process that leads to the transformation of one set of chemical substances to another and that is the subject matter of a DataGeneratingActivity. no ChecksumAlgorithm See DCAT-AP specs:ChecksumAlgorithm no InChi A structure descriptor which conforms to the InChI format specification. no Policy See DCAT-AP specs:Policy no DissolvingSubstance A liquid ChemicalSubstance that dissolves or that is capable of dissolving a ChemicalSubstance. no EvaluatedActivity An activity or process that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. no Identifier See DCAT-AP specs:Identifier no SupportiveEntity The supportive entities are supporting the main entities in the Application Profile. They are included in the Application Profile because they form the range of properties. no Any This abstract class is needed to create the union of Dataset, DatasetSeries, Catalogue and DataService for the range of the slot primary_topic. no DataService See DCAT-AP specs:DataService yes QuantitativeAttribute A quantifiable piece of information that is attributed to an Entity, Activity or AgenticEntity. no Resource See DCAT-AP specs:Resource no Standard See DCAT-AP specs:Standard no InChIKey no Concentration A QuantitativeAttribute of a ChemicalSubstance that represents the amount of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture. no Reactor A reactor is a container for controlling a biological or chemical reaction or process. no SMILES A structure descriptor that denotes a molecular structure as a graph and conforms to the SMILES format specification. no QualitativeAttribute A piece of information that is attributed to an Entity, Activity or AgenticEntity. no RightsStatement See DCAT-AP specs:RightsStatement no TimeInstant See DCAT-AP specs:TimeInstant no Catalogue See DCAT-AP specs:Catalogue yes MolecularFormula A structure descriptor which identifies each constituent element by its chemical symbol and indicates the number of atoms of each element found in each discrete molecule of that compound. no AnalysisDataset A Dataset that was generated by an analysis of some previously generated data. For example, a dataset that contains the data of an assignment of a chemical structure to a sample based on the spectral data obtained from the sample is an AnalyticalDataset. no Laboratory A facility that provides controlled conditions in which scientific or technological research, experiments, and measurement may be performed. no Temperature A physical quantity that quantitatively expresses the attribute of hotness or coldness. no Yield A dimensionless physical quantity describing the fraction of a product B that is formed from a reactant A taking into account the stoichiometry. If A fully reacts to B without side-reactions, the yield of product B is 1 (or 100 %). no PercentageOfTotal A dimensionless ratio that quantifies the stoichiometric proportion of a chemical substance relative to a reference substance in a chemical reaction. no Role See DCAT-AP specs:Role no MolarMass A Mass (physical quality) that quantifies the mass of a homogeneous ChemicalSubstance containing 6.02 x 10^23 atoms or molecules. no DataGeneratingActivity An Activity (process) that has the objective to produce information (in form of a dataset) about another Activity or Entity. no

docs.title: Subset: DomainAgnosticCore
docs.text:
The elements of this subset are considered the core layer of our DCAT-AP extension.

URI: DomainAgnosticCore

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/nfdi-de/dcat-ap-plus/chemistry/

docs.title: Classes in subset
docs.text: Class Description Activity See DCAT-AP specs:Activity AgenticEntity An entity that is somehow responsible for an Activity to take place. AnalysisDataset A Dataset that was generated by an analysis of some previously generated data. For example, a dataset that contains the data of an assignment of a chemical structure to a sample based on the spectral data obtained from the sample is an AnalyticalDataset. AnalysisSourceData Information that was evaluated within a DataAnalysis. ClassifierMixin A mixin with which an entity of this schema can be classified via an additional rdf:type or dcterms:type assertion. DataAnalysis An Activity that evaluates the data produced by another Activity. DataGeneratingActivity An Activity (process) that has the objective to produce information (in form of a dataset) about another Activity or Entity. Dataset A collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more representations. DefinedTerm A word, name, acronym or phrase that is defined in a controlled vocabulary (CV) and that is used to provide an additional rdf:type or dcterms:type of a class within this schema. Device A material instrument that is designed to perform a function primarily by means of its mechanical or electrical nature. Entity A physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary. EvaluatedActivity An activity or process that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. EvaluatedEntity An Entity that is being evaluated in a DataGeneratingActivity. Plan A piece of information that specifies how an activity has to be carried out by its agents including what kind of steps have to be taken and what kind of parameters have to be met/set. QualitativeAttribute A piece of information that is attributed to an Entity, Activity or AgenticEntity. QuantitativeAttribute A quantifiable piece of information that is attributed to an Entity, Activity or AgenticEntity. Software An instrument composed of a series of instructions that can be interpreted by or directly executed by a computer. Surrounding The surrounding in which the dataset creating activity took place (e.g. a lab).

docs.title: Merged model
docs.text:
This folder contains the fully resolved pid4cat model, including all imported models. The files are auto-generated from the schema in the src/chem_dcat_ap/schema folder and version-stamped by uv-dynamic-versioning. For releases, these files are copied to gh-pages along with the rest of the documentation, making schema files with version information available on gh-pages. The w3id.org redirects link to these files.

Note, that the generated files are git-ignored.
